Reviews.Title: “Perfect for City Break - Clean with really friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: P W
Reviews.Content: We booked an economy double and were nicely surprised by a good-size, spotlessly clean room on the 5th floor with plenty of storage space and an equally spotlessly clean, roomy bathroom. The bedroom's balcony gave added space and a lovely view of the Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore. I cannot stress enough how impressed I was with the cleanliness of everything. The clean, airy breakfast room has another great view of the Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore and the people passing by, and the food was basic but fresh, nicely presented and the service was super friendly and helpful. This is the perfect hotel for a Rome city break, with Termini only 2 blocks away, and I seriously recommend this hotel as a base for a city break, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good value small hotel near the central station”
Reviews.Author: AbsolutelyDubrovnik
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a base for a winter sightseeing break in Rome where we needed a hotel that was convenient for Rail travel and car rental/car hire as this was a part of a larger European Tour. The hotel is in the process of renovating the lobby and several floors but still keeps very tidy and clean. The hotel had some period furnishings in our room which gave it some character but were a little dated and probably in need of renovation also. The hotel was quiet and provided a good nights sleep - not a small achievement in Rome. The breakfast buffet was included and great. The customer service was superb from the welcome, speed of check-in, arranging for cabs/taxis, to the great explanation of Rome's sites. All in all, a good experience

Reviews.Title: “Should not be classified as 4*”
Reviews.Author: Pensionerexplorer
Reviews.Content: The hotel was centrally located and clean, the staff (at reception) was helpful ...and that is all the positive comments I can make!... On the negative side: No tea/coffee making facilities,in the rooms or in lounge.. No bar, Very poor breakfast buffet, plastic glasses!!!: Will not stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: SEN15
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here for 3 nights. I liked the location, close to shops, restaurants and just 15-20 minute walk to the Colosseum. The breakfast was good, I enjoyed the pastries, ham, cheese etc... Our room was clean and surprisingly big. (I expected a small room). The front desk/service was satisfactory overall. I would stay here again the next time I go back to Rome. grazie!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: Victoria H
Reviews.Content: Pulled up to hOtel and I didn't think much of it ,but once inside it was modern and clean looking,The rooms were nice and clean and tidy the staff were friendly,and there was an great little irish bar right on the door step and fantastic restaurants within a 5 min walk,hotel was central tO all the main attractions,we had a great time in Rome,I would deffo recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Shabby & Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Passyparis290
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the worst I've ever stayed at. Everything is dated with an air of shabbiness about it. The strangest thing was that I never saw or heard another guest while I was there. Rather spooky. The worst thing was the traffic noise. As tired as I was, I got not one wink of sleep with the constant rush of traffic. I finally got up 2 hrs earlier than necessary to leave early for the airport-anything to get out of there. The only thing going for this place is the location. It is close to everything. Oh, and there was a heat & a/c control which didn't work at all.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel more like 2”
Reviews.Author: Bouyaka
Reviews.Content: Not 4 star more like budget hotel. Not good value for money at 90euros per night! But cleanish and great location for old Rome but if travelling alone be careful as lots of unsavoury people and pickpockets in area! Choose somewhere else! U will be dissappointed! Also room was tiny and shower minature and thin wall meant i could hear the annoying inconsiderate noisy people staying here! Breakfast gave me a bad stomach so best to avoid even if it is included! Not sure how this hotel gets away with calling themselves a 4 star!

Reviews.Title: “very bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: fady711
Reviews.Content: it is very bad hotel not friendly people and don't have dinner or lunch menu, and very bad room service and wireless very slow in room.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Holiday09London
Reviews.Content: This is not a 4 star hotel, nor does it live up to the expectations from the website or the price. It is very old and in need of a full refurbishment. There was noisy building work in the front and back of the building and the walls are paper thin. Breakfast was simple but fine. Having not been to Rome before I didn't know which part of town to stay in, we choose the Hotel Commodore as it was close to the train station, and advertised it self as close to all main Rome attractions. It is in fact a good 20 minutes walk to any sights of interest and another 20 minute walk to the rest. We loved Rome but not the Hotel Commodore

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for Rome”
Reviews.Author: unrealneil
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in a triple room with my wife and ten year old daughter for two nights. The positives first, of which there are many. The first gentleman at check in could not have been more friendly and helpful. Despite arriving very early with the expectation of storing our bags until 2pm he secured our room. Thus we were able to change and enjoy a full day in Rome. The room was comfortable, the Aircon worked and the shower and bathroom were fine. Its not 5 star but it is clean and well serviced. Breakfast was excellent, again with friendly staff and a good choice of bread and meat. Coffee was good too. So the negative. On Sunday it poured with rain in Rome. Walking back to the hotel where we had left our bags we were drenched, my 10 year old daughter was cold. Before our flight we wanted to dry and change and asked the guy on reception if we could use a towel. This request was not unreasonable but it was flatly refused. It's a little thing but it wasn't good service and undermined slightly the good work of all the other staff. All in all though the hotel represents excellent value and a good product in a convenient location. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Old hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scoobykuboi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one night. It was under renovation, but there was no noise at night and in the morning. The frond desk was very friendly but just very old hotel. I can not believe this hotel has four stars because of the room condition. Breakfast is OK and location is very good near Rome Termini station.

Reviews.Title: “esperienza terribile”
Reviews.Author: sesse75
Reviews.Content: They gave me a really tiny and noisy room; the ceiling was scraping and the closet smelled bad. The bed was a single one and the bath was really really small. It was probably well cleaned, but was so old and outdated and worn out that it also seemed dirty. I had to ask four times for a hairdryer, as it was not provided. Standard breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: hopeisimportant
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in September. First impressions of the Hotel were that on decor alone this should not be 4-star (although I'm not sure what constitutes 4-star) but we did pay 3-star price for it. Apart from the dated decor I can't fault this hotel. Excellent breakfast and the staff were very helpful. It is within walking distance of the Train Station and close to many other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Roaming the streets of Rome”
Reviews.Author: AussieSophia
Reviews.Content: Location was perfect - close to Central Station and the bus terminals. View from balcony looks out to the Basillica Santa Maria - you can hear the bell chimes on the hour! Room was clean with beautiful decor. Breakfast had a variety of dishes & the breakfast staff were so polite & respectful and ensured your coffee order was done pronto! Staff at the front desk were happy to help with any queries.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great breakfast and great staff”
Reviews.Author: netninja
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, close to the termini (train and subway stations) and not too far of a walk from many of the great sites. The area around the hotel is safe and clean as well, and the staff was helpful as well. The only complaint I could possibly have about our stray was the slight smell that was in the rooms but due to the heatr and humidity the smell would disappear with the AC on higher. If I go back to Rome I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Should be classed as a three star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cavecanem76
Reviews.Content: Good friendly service by staff, even if they could smile a bit more... Breakfast was quite basic... but not as basic as room - small beds and very dry ambience. Felt like landing in the 70s. Cery clean and close to attactions and transport system. Good value for what you get though, even so would try looking for somewhere else next visit.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: derfekils
Reviews.Content: we loved the commodore.the staff were friendly and helpful(esp christiano). a nice clean hotel..location was super for many must see sights.close to termini and repubblica for trains and metro.short walk to colosseum,trevi fountain and spanish steps.we had booked a night at the opera and were delighted it was only a stones throw away.via nazionale nearby for shopping,plenty good restaurants on doorstep.we will be going back to rome in the near future and will stay at the commodore when we do.

Reviews.Title: “if i would ever go back to Rome again, i would definitely stay there!”
Reviews.Author: nikolg
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband went to Rome for our Easter holidays.The hotel was situated in a very good spot between the Termini and Republica station (almost same distance). The service was very helpful and pleasant. The room was cosy,comfortable enough and so was the bathroom. I must say, i found the breakfast quite indulging, and one thing that i have never encountered in other hotels (which i find the most important): Every day we had our room cleaned, changed the towels and the sheets!! just perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price. Recommendable.”
Reviews.Author: Phileas_Fogg_74
Reviews.Content: Pros: Excellent location, walking distance from Termini train station and major city attractions. Great price when booked via the internet (not from the hotel's site). Standard breakfast, all tasted well. Clean room, bed linen, etc. Quiet. Not a "dangerous" area. Cons: Friendly staff but only basic English. Wi-Fi works only at the reception area and it is not free. Very old furniture in the room. Hot tap water left plenty of rust/dirt residue, cold tap less residue, still undrinkable. Not a 4-star. It is a very good choice for those more interested in sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Cazzan
Reviews.Content: Hotel Commodore is in an excellent location - near the main Termini station and right by the first stop of the 'Ciao' Hop-on Hop-off bus tour. The Colusseum is walkable in about 15 mins. The hotel claims its a 4 star which I dont agree with. There was no tea/coffee making facilities and the rooms and rooms are pretty basic (our room was also quite gloomily decorated but that did not really matter). We tried to open our window at night which turned out to appear to be opening the next rooms window too!! Rooms had mini-bar, tv (only 1 english channel), safe and ensuite (with the worlds smallest shower!!). Breakfast was a buffet style with cereal, croissants, rolls, orange juice, tea/coffee, cold meats, yoghurts etc. Staff were friendly and helpfull and we were able to leave our luggage on our last day as we didnt fly till the evening. Fabulous location but more a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't call it 4 star”
Reviews.Author: AJandMG
Reviews.Content: No tea or coffee facilities in the room. The walls are a bit thin too so you might wake up the same time as the room next to you. Breakfast was quite plain. The only hot food was eggs but no toast and the fruit was all tinned. However, staff were quite friendly and helpful. The place was clean and it is close to a decent train line at Termini.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Train Station (Rome Termini)”
Reviews.Author: Jeff_and_Dianne
Reviews.Content: We were just looking for a basic hotel close to the train station and that is what we found with the Commodore. It calls itself a 4 star, but that is a little high. No complaints, though. The rooms were fine, and the ensuite adequate. Service was very friendly. The airconditioning is in the hallways, not the rooms (not an issue in June). The wireless internet worked fine and is complementary. There is a small bar and breakfast was included (but did not try them out). Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowScotty
Reviews.Content: Good location, close to major sights such as Colosseum, walking distance from others such as the Trevi Fountain, etc. Clean and simple accommodation, reasonable price, and the breakfasts were a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Litte Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OilerFans
Reviews.Content: The room was small but clean and comfortable. Good location as very close to train station(walking distance) and short walk to Coloseum and many other sights. Breakfast was included and was not five star but definitely good enough for us. No complaints about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to Termini”
Reviews.Author: prasenberg
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Commodore for two nights. Having traveled to Rome at least twenty times, I am by now quite familiar with Roman hotels. For new travelers to Rome the location close to Termini (central station) and the Santa Maria Maggiore is nice, but the main attractions like the Forum, St. Peter's and the centro storico are elsewhere in town. However, since you are within walking distance from the station, you can easily get a bus a metro there. Or you can walk all the way of course, as Rome is a delight to explore on foot! The hotel itself looks a bit drab on the outside. Inside it looks a lot better than you'd expect, although it does have this 1970s feel. My room was on the top floor, where the promised wifi did not work. I think I was just unlucky, as it worked on all other floors just fine. The staff had no technical knowledge whatsoever, but in general were very friendly and helpful. The room was quite small though. This was compensated by a bathroom and shower that was just a large as the room itself. Breakfast was pretty good. All in all I think the hotel is good value for what I spent. If I ever need to stay in this neighbourhood in Rome again, I might consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Termini Roma”
Reviews.Author: Sunny190
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 1 15 am, nearly six hours late due to problems with flights from the UK, but the gentleman at reception was very helpful and we were in our room very quickly. The room was small, but the facilities were clean and comfortable. No view to speak of, only the windows of the building opposite, but we didn't spend too much time in the room anyway. Because of the difficulties with flights, etc, in the UK, we hadn't had an opportunity to confirm a Vatican tour starting at 7 00 am the next morning but, again, with the assistance of the hotel reception staff, we were picked up from the hotel. The hotel is only a 5-10 minute walk (depends if you have luggage to weigh you down) to the Termini, and the Santa Maria Maggiore is opposite the street where the hotel is. The breakfast was good, and the staff very attentive. We would certainly recommend this hotel as good, budget priced accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Have our Reservation!”
Reviews.Author: KMUsher
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a one night stay at Hotel Commodore for December 27th. We booked through Romeby.com and I received two confirmation emails. We booked back in July! On December 21st (while in Rome at another hotel), I called Hotel Commodore directly to confirm our reservation for the night of the 27th. The man I spoke to on December 21st said he had no record of our hotel reservation for that night under my name. He also left it as that without offering to help me find the reservation even after asking if he could look it up another way. When I logged into my Romeby account after speaking to the gentleman, the Hotel Commodore reservation was still listed. So, I cancelled it. Luckily, the Rome hotel we were staying at for the first leg of our trip had a room available for us and were very helpful. I regret to inform you that Hotel Commodore never answered my emails when I booked months ago. I received no communication, only a form email reservation confirmation, which apparently wasn't legit. I will not be recommending this hotel to anyone. Since we did not get to see or stay in the hotel, so I can't give it a "real" review. -Kristen Usher

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: UKLors
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a long weekend in Rome, staying at the Hotel Commodore. I agree with most of the posts on here. It's in a great location, just a short walk from the train station, and a 10-15 min walk into the ancient part of Rome, past lots of gelato bars and restaurants! We felt very safe and happily wandered around the area at night. Our room and ensuite were a good size (also I thought our shower was normal size, not tiny at all) and very clean. The service we received was excellent and very friendly and the staff always said hello and smiled and made us feel welcome. Breakfast was ok, not a huge selection and mostly continental, but certainly sufficient. We had a late evening flight back and the staff looked after our bags for us all day. They also mentioned they have a room available for freshening up in, if we needed to when we picked our bags up, but we didnt take avantage of that (running for the plane...). Overall I would recommend it if you are looking for a well priced hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not a 4*”
Reviews.Author: manishad
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a long weekend in Rome. Hotel Commodore is in a great location. Abt 5 minutes walk from Termini. In a safe location. Didn't feel unsafe walking back in the last evenings. Alot of places to eat and shop near by on Via Nationale, etc. The room we got was large, and clean. Toilet very clean. But the shower was tiny! No frills. Enjoyable stay. Hotel receptionist in the night shift was very friendly. Gave a brief description of the area, went through the Rome map, etc. Breakfast was average. Continental. All in all, hotel was good, but it's definitely got a 4*. I would say 3*.

Reviews.Title: “They got their four stars in the seventies”
Reviews.Author: AUiCathan
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from the Hotel Commodore in Rome where we spent the bank holiday weekend and the only way that this hotel got it's four stars is if it was reviewed in the seventies. We booked this hotel on recommendations from this site but I would warn anyone who is looking to stay there that it is most definitely a low three star hotel. When we arrived on Friday afternoon, the 'receptionist' grunted at us for our passports and then took our reservation. We were then shown to our room which had no working air conditioning and the carpets had visible stains. It also turned out to be very noisy at night-time. We were told what time breakfast was at and that was it. After we settled in we went downstairs again to ask about getting an iron and a kettle for the room. We were told that there was no iron but an ironing service - at a cost, and there was no kettle in the room due to health and safety and when I enquired about getting some hot water brought to the room for medicinal purposes I was told that they could not provide this as the bar facilties had closed two months ago! When we were checking out another 'Receptionist' grunted at us 'Minibar??' to which I presumed she meant had we taken anything from it. When I told her what we took she just worked on her pc and gave me the invoice. There was no smile or thank you when we paid and left. The only saving grace for this hotel is the fact that it is very central to all locations and the train station, and the night porter is one of the most cheeriest and helpful people I have met. You may think that I am being overly critical but I work in the service industry and this is not the way to run a hotel. I would advise against staying here unless you have no other option.

Reviews.Title: “A very good, well situated hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Nick_Harris
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Commodore is in an excellent location, a short walk from the Termini. When we checked in on the Sunday evening, the Receptionist was brilliant, nothing was too much trouble for him. He supplied us with maps, guides and lots of useful tips when we told him it was our first time in Rome. Our room was clean, roomy and well appointed with very good a/c (much needed in Rome in July). The TV had lots of local channels plus several sports channels, CNN and BBC World. The fridge in the room had enough space for us to put our own drinks , but all the mini bar drinks were only 2 euros each! Breakfast was typical continental fare, lots of fruit, bread, cereals, pastries, cheese and meats - no toast and no hot food, but more than adequate. There were lots of shops and restaurant in easy walking distance of the hotel and it was very handy as a touring base, being in walking distance of all the major attractions except the Vatican and only a short walk to the Termini and tour bus stops. All in all I would have no problem recommending this hotel as a base for your stay in the beautiful city that is Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ezziem
Reviews.Content: I booked a double room for the first two nights, and was very happy with the room and the assistance from the front desk. I was so impressed I booked a room for an extra night direct through the hotel. The room was clean and cool, and the bed was very firm. The breakfast buffet is excellent and provides quite a bit of choice from cold cuts, cheese, eggs, pastries, fresh fruit and more. I was also impressed with the large jug of hot coffee! The location is very good, and is close to all the sites, including Trevi Fountain. The train staion is close by, as is all the good shopping strips and restaurants and cafe's. I was more than happy with this hotel and had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Commodore just average”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaChicago
Reviews.Content: Hotel Commodore is a typical hotel that can be found anywhere in the world. Average service with average amenities. Nothing in the decor would allude to the fact that you are in Rome. The only problem that we encountered is that they were supposed to have made reservations for us to visit the Borghese Gallery and the Vatican Museum but failed to do so. Fortunately, we were able to work around this and didn't have a problem getting into either place. Hotel is located about four blocks from Train Station and off the main street, so noise is not an issue during the evening. Breakfast was typical fare of rolls, yogurt, scrambled eggs and a variety of meats and cheeses.

Reviews.Title: “lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: duvnas
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room with an extra bed, but when we came to the hotel all double rooms were booked, but we were instead offered a junior suite for the same price. The staff was so friendly and cheerful we almost wanted to adopt them. they made our stay in Rome. Jonas, Ylva & Dea

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Brendan_Ireland
Reviews.Content: My Wife and i stayed in The Commodore for two nights during our honeymoon at the end of April. The location was excellent, about a 5 minute walk from the Terminus just off Via Cavour. The room was clean and well maintained. The view was off the back of another building, but that is quite common in Rome. After a long train journey to Rome, we went straight for a drink from the minibar, which we thought was very good value at €2 per item. The hotel is about a ten minute walk from the Colosseum ( straight down via cavour) and there are a few nice restaurants on Via Cavour also. You can also reach the Spanish Steps and the Trevi fountain quite easily. The staff in the hotel were friendly, especially the concierge that was on duty when we arrived and left. He spoke excellent english and was very helpful with directions etc. He also arrange a transfer to the airport for €48 in a well maintained mercedes. The breakfast was continental , however it did the job. There was a small residents bar, with an eccentric but nice barman ( i think he was covering for the normal guy), there was also an Irish bar around the corner with live bands most nights. In summary the hotel was in a good location, clean , reasonably priced and the staff were nice, we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay, convenient to the sights”
Reviews.Author: adbracey
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as part of a package from Air France Holidays. The original hotel we were booked at made a mistake in the reservation (they admitted it freely) and moved us to this hotel. It was 2:00 PM local time when we arrived, after being up for 24 hours, and the staff was very accomodating. The room was small by American standards, but clean and quiet. It was a short walk to the Roma Termini Metro station. The breakfast was excellent, particularly the Caffe Latte. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room smelled OK but the common areas and front desk area had a stale, moldy smell. This is not a 4 star hotel...maybe a low 3. I requested a shower but we got a tub with hand held showerhead (difficult to use) and there is not even kleenex in the bathroom. We had no view but the back of another building...but it was quiet. This is very close to the train station but virtually nothing else. Breakfast is 7-10 but we went to breakfast the 1st day at 9AM and they were virtually out of everything...even plates! We do not watch much TV while traveling but do turn on the news occasionally while dressing. The small (13"?) TV was perched on top of the minibar under the window & difficult to see from that angle. The one good thing they do offer is a driver (48 euro) to take you to the airport. Since we were leaving very early, this was convenient. However, we would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Tired 4*”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Entrance seems OK but reality is that it is all very dated & in my opinion not a 4* hotel. Location is really good, 10mins from main station. The hotel staff are very friendly, polite & helpful. The room was clean & cleaned daily. Breakfast was good/average. I think if you go expecting a 3* you will not be disappointed

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Commodore Roma
HotelInfo.Address: Via Torino, 1, 00184 Rome, Italy
